boolean.comment: The type is an object wrapper for a corresponding (untyped) primitive value

integer_as_object.comment: The type is an object wrapper for a corresponding (untyped) primitive value

float_64_bit.comment: The Number wrapper object is represented by a double-precision 64-bit float under the hood

float_as_object.comment: The type is an object wrapper for a corresponding (untyped) primitive value

char.comment: It's possible to use single-character strings, such as the output of String.prototype.charAt()

string_as_array.comment: String objects support [index] notation to dereference characters, but do not support the full spectrum of array methods
